page.title: 02LANDSCAPE, CONTINUED
page.content: There are scattered farms, some buildings date from the 14th century, and are still constructed of "wattle and daub". Other buildings are brick and timber framed built in the Georgian and Victorian periods, and have been modernised. Other houses have been built during the last fifty years. Some houses are owner occupied, and some are owned by the Mid Sussex District Council and are rented by the occupiers. Some of the farms are farmed by the owners, and some are farmed by tenants. Most of the "tied" cottages, originally occupied by the farm workers, are now privately owned and have been modernised. There are two churches, at Twineham (O.S.252199) and Sayers Common (O.S. 268186) Twineham Church is early Tudor brick built, the other is Victorian and is of flint and brick construction
